Reviews.Title: “" Good Small Hotel "”
Reviews.Author: mosesrozario1
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very friendly , i stayed with my friends , we really enjoyed they have a Indian cook, he can cook good indian food, Pierro he is funny guy , he will make you laugh , Internet is free, you can walk to Metro station Rebibia. :)

Reviews.Title: “excellent for groups”
Reviews.Author: aljosamerljak
Reviews.Content: we stayed three nights in winter and the place was perfect. very cheap, great stuff, very helpfull, nice cook (if u want to have a group dinner, just ask them one or two days before, during your stay) good location, very clean rooms with tv, phone, fridge. recommend for groups!

Reviews.Title: “Total crap stay in bus terminal”
Reviews.Author: Domvmn
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel i have ever staye in the rooms dont have windows the showers are falling apart noise does not stop please take my advise and go somewhere else dont look at the price because it will ruin your holiday

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and basic.”
Reviews.Author: SammyUgg
Reviews.Content: This isn't really a hotel in the modern meaning of the word -- it is basically a motel (or bed and breakfast). It reminded me of those American motels which can be seen in movies. I stayed there for two nights. It is located in a nice residential area, close to the Rebibbia metro station (Line B). Therefore, connection to central Rome is easy and painless (about 20 minutes away). The room was clean enough and the staff was fun. Sound isolation is terrible, so you can hear people talking in the room next to yours. Breakfast is basic, but okay. The WiFi is free for all guests. It was fairly cheap, so the value you get for the price is great.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL, CLOSE TO METRO, GOOD SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: 186600Kate
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to metro station-5 mins walk. This is very handy to get to the centre of Rome. It only takes 15-20 mins to get to the city centre. The reception staff is very helpful and polite. The breakfast is basic but they serve very nice coffee. I didnt quite like the hotel restaurant. The price seem OK but you get dine better in the centre of Rome. The rooms are good size and AC was working fine. The bathroom is Ok, shower a bit small but still OK. There is a supermarket close to the hotel, where you can get yoghurt, fruits, sweets, water etc. There is a computer in the reception that you can use. It is a nice hotel if you do not want to spend a fortune but still be quite close to the city centre (close to the metro station-huge advantage). I truly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, cheerful and with great access to city!”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca_Lobb
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews I was a little sceptical going here. Especially as we rolled up to the hotel the surrounding area is a dive! However, the hotel staff were amazing. They gave us maps, directions to everything and where places were easy to walk to. Really helpful. The tube (Rebbebia) is literally a 5 minute walk away and within 15 minutes you are in the main city of Rome. It was dead handy! (3 day ticket is 12 euro- bargain!) The hotel was clean, sheets changed everyday. I could have done with an extra pillow but that's just my preference. The breakfast was a bit rubbish but what do you expect when you go on the cheap. It had everything we needed and we would stay here again if we ever come back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The cheapest you will find”
Reviews.Author: operte
Reviews.Content: We didn't find anything cheaper that would both have a private bathroom and be close to the subway. We were afraid that it would look really bad but actually it is a comfortable place to rest if you are on a tourist visit to Rome. The reception is always open and very welcoming. The rooms are clean and the breakfast is simple but it does the trick. The only problems I found were the bad shape in which the window covers were in (if we didn't put another piece of cloth covering the window, anyone who passed outside could clearly see everything inside the bedroom) and the constant sound of a machine working (presumably something related with air conditioning) that wouldn't allow me to have a deep sleep. Also, the walls are extremelly thin so you could hear everything that was going on in the water pumps (I always woke up when someone decided to take a shower at 6 a.m.). Despite all this, we didn't hear anything else like cars or people speaking so if you are somewhat comfortable with noise while sleeping, this is a good hotel to choose. Just don't forget to ask the reception to give you a room in which the window is fully covered.

Reviews.Title: “My opinion”
Reviews.Author: robertas55
Reviews.Content: We like: Cleanliness - it was wonderful. Rooms are cleared every day as well towels are changed daily. Staff - helpful and very friendly. Location ~250metres from Rebibbia metro station - very good if you are going to centre of Rome. We didn't like: Breakfast - it is called "CONTINENTAL" - that wasn't continental breakfast. It consisted from - cerial, milk, bread, jam and coffe/tea. And it was always the same! It is awfull if you are staying more than one night. 3* - it's NOT a 3* hotel. There are no windows in rooms - only glass doors. Air conditioner - doesn't work properly. It's always too hot.

Reviews.Title: “Someone satisfied, someone not, but the price can be very good”
Reviews.Author: Ondra_CZ_Prague
Reviews.Content: It depends on what you expect from 3 star hotel – and it also depends on which room you get – see below! If travel on low budget or want to get average service – can be positively surprised, if compare to 3 star experience somewhere else - can be slightly disappointed… We stayed in May 2011. POSITIVE: • Price • Cleanness • Rooms equipment • Reservations + payment, 24 hour‘s reception NEGATIVE: • Breakfasts (including staff) • Some rooms may be noisy • Different experience in the same rooms PRICE: • Quite advantageous to accommodation possibilities in Rome • It varies significantly –depends on the advance reservation + season (for double room from 45 to 100 EUR). We paid 60 EUR for double room in May 2011 (reservation made 2 months in advance) • Breakfast included (see notes below!) • Positive - price for our 4 days stay was fixed since the time of our reservation even it has increased on the hotel web in the meantime ROOMS - EQUIPMENT: • Different experience - depending on the room position – see later !! • Has private bathroom – with sink, hairdryer, bidet and shower (the entrance to shower box is very, very narrow - some no-slim person may have problems to get in, really !) • Queen Size Bed = two beds put together • Air condition (worked well in May – 23C outside) • Safe, TV /all included/, telephone • Wardrobe, bedside tables /at least in double rooms/, table, chair • In room 125 there were also: fridge for free, quite enough space (don’t know whether it is in other rooms) - Rooms cleaning - every day (including new towels), hotel & rooms are clean - There are NO tea kettle facilities in rooms ROOMS - IMPORTANT NOTES: • (Except for rooms 125 + 127): Room’s entrance door are made of glass in its upper half (glass is covered by sunblind). There is also the only very small window, so the rooms may be dark in daylight. • Some rooms can be noisy as someone complained in review below. The higher is the room number, the more noisy it is (rush street at one hotel’s edge, quiet place at the opposite one). • In accordance with both ours and someone’s below experience the best rooms are No 125 or 127 (there are only 2 rooms on the first floor), the second ones in order are the rooms with the lowest numbers. HOTEL: • 300 m from underground station Rebibbia, 200m from local bus terminal, close to Rome circular highway • Located in residential area • Hotel is clean • Wi-Fi + Internet (1 PC) at the reception area - for free HOTEL - FOOD: • Restaurant – only breakfast + dinner (7-11 PM) – nothing special (price comparable with other restaurants and average quality). Service may depend on the season – in May they didn‘t offer a lunch promoted at their web site. • Breakfast (included in room‘s price) – 8-9:30 AM. ALWAYS THE SAME OFFER (only white bread, jam, butter + cake). Tea, coffee, milk, instant drink. No juice or another ingredients mentioned in below reviews (may also differ during the season?). After some days you may starve for the change! STAFF: • Quite pleasant, trying to be helpful, English speaking mostly • Only one Italian speaking lady very unpleasant and absolutelly not customer-oriented specially during the breakfast time ! PAYMENT: • Reservation: online, by phone, mail. We used email [info@hotelmetroroma.com] to our satisfaction. The best way for us seemed to pay directly to the hotel (some servers offered almost double price for the room at the same time) • Advance deposit: 1 night’s price (non-refundable) – money transfer to Italy (within Europe) took more than a week! • Payment at the hotel – upon the ARRIVAL. Possible by credit card (we were not inform about that so paid cash) • City tax – 2 EUR per night/person – paid only by cash HINTS: • There is the perfect map of Rome for free at the hotel’s reception ! Take it – very helpful! • By December 2012 there’s no operation on the Rome’s underground line A (this is not that one close to the hotel!) – it operates only by 9PM (except Saturdays). The line B (towards to hotel) operates by 11:30PM (until 0:30am on Saturdays) • Buy ROMA PASS (25 EUR) – it includes 3 days free public transportation including some trains (ones to airport NOT included) + 2 free visits into some museums or sightseeings. Main advantage we discovered – you do not need to stay one hour in the line to Colosseum and can get in immediately ! (http://www.romapass.it)

Reviews.Title: “Well situated but a bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: stefski
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights here: The good points: A short walk to the metro station and easy commute to the centre. Very secure parking with plenty of spaces. Free wi-fi in reception area and breakfast room. Helpful reception staff. Fair sized room. Air conditioning OK. Other points: Very basic accommodation reminded me of a Butlin's holiday camp block in the early 60's. Forget breakfast - it was instantly forgetable. Had dinner in the restaurant on the first night - didn't eat there again! Hotel clientelle appeared to be a mixture of tourists and longer term "residents". We toured Europe stopping at the following cities and hotels: Reims, France: Suite Novotel Beaune, France: Hotel Alesia Annecy France: Hotel Alexandra Novara, Italy: Hotel Croce di Malta Florence, Italy: Hotel Diva Rome, Italy: Metro Hotel Naples, Italy: Ramada Hotel Bari, Italy: B & B La Rosa Blu Igoumenitsa, Greece: Selefkos Palace Hotel Lefkada, Greece: Vaya Appts Achaia Beach, Patra, Greece; Hotel Achaia Beach Nafplio, Greece: Hotel Nafplia Stoupa, Greece: Zervas Appartments Olympia, Greece: Hotel Pelops Kefalonia, Greece: Hotel Marina Bay Mestre, Venice, Italy: Hotel Bologna, Best Western Munich, Germany: Hotel Cristal, Best Western Mainz, Germany: Inter City Hotel Ghent, Belgium: Hotel Ibis Centrum

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Gully2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Metro Hotel Roma several times, and I have to say I strongly recommend the hotel. Is a new building, new beds new bathroom. Breakfast is not to bad. Is true is a bit far from the center, but it takes only 15-20 minutes in metro to get there. Just remember that to come back to the hotel, the last train leaves at 11.30pm from Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable hotel with fast access to central rome”
Reviews.Author: terenceyang
Reviews.Content: first stayed in room 100 but noise level high as next to kitchen so shifted, but this is the biggest room in the motel. Shifted to second floor, noise level lower, be advised staff only mop the toilet and as ventilation is poor, you'll be hit by strong pong of urine smell. Also as price is low you'll get a lot of school groups staying and teenagers do make a bit of noise. there are no road signs on the roads outside the metro nor maps inside the metro, make sure you check out the hotel map before setting off. once you leave the metro gates, take the right side steps heading up. ahead of you is the mini bus station. walk all the way to the traffic light. cross the light and walk 50m pass the car rental place. after tat you'll see the motel which is hidden behind an apartment block.

Reviews.Title: “not as expected”
Reviews.Author: travelerjane123
Reviews.Content: I flew into Rome for further travel to Puglia so we stayed for the weekend. The room was good sized but the bathroom was a shoe box; im not exaggerating!! It was also quite hot that day and the air conditioning is controlled by the front desk. We asked if they could turn on the air for the night and they said they had no way of controlling the air because the temperatures in April can change from one moment to the next. So we had to sleep with 'clothing optional' as to not have a heat stroke! And I am from Miami!!! Also a double is 2 singles pushed together. Dont try to cuddle or you will fall through the middle. I would not stay here more than a night. It is not conveniently located unless you have a GPS and a car. The area is somewhat seedy. They charge you for parking-which is on their premises. Overall I would say overrated.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal when driving to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Texan-in-Italy
Reviews.Content: We (family with 2 teenagers) booked this hotel for the weekend based on the availability of secure parking and walking distance to a metro stop. And of course an affordable rate: hotels in Rome are quite pricey. The hotel was easy to get to from the autostrada, parking (for a small fee) was in the gated compound, and the quad room was surprisingly spacious and very clean. I thought it would be noisy, judging from the poor acoustics in the breakfast lobby area, but we did not experience the noise that others complained about. Service was good, an adequate breakfast was included in our low room rate. It was just 2 short blocks to the Rebibbia metro station (last stop on the red line) and despite the dodgy/dirty looking area, we never felt unsafe even coming back late at night. To summarize, if you come to Rome by car, park it outside town (I would never drive in town), take the metro, spend your money on a good dinner and the night in this affordable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny bathroom”
Reviews.Author: KLibs7
Reviews.Content: Okay location. My main problem (my husband and I both being very tall) was the tiny bathroom. If I was going to the bathroom, I could brush my teeth in the sink at the same time. The beds are not comfortable at all.

Reviews.Title: “not my favorite”
Reviews.Author: jnanderson
Reviews.Content: not close to anything but was cheap and clean. be sure to have transportation if staying here.

Reviews.Title: “okay hotel in a horrible location”
Reviews.Author: Abroadstudent
Reviews.Content: The rooms were really nice but the location is horrible. You have to take a subway (underground, train) at least 8 stops to get to actual Rome. Although the rooms looked rather nice, there was a strong smell of cigarettes in the bathroom all three rooms which we booked and at night it was strikingly hot. Hot enough we didn't feel comfortable at all. The internet is not wi-fi, its a computer in the lobby free to use, but usually busy. Really, if you want to see central Rome, it's better to stay much closer than here. The rooms were pretty nice looking, nice tile flooring, flat screen TVs. However the "double bed" is really just 2 twins pushed together, which is rather annoying. As for the breakfast it's a strictly Italian breakfast, just toast, butter, croissants, and juice. I really don't recommend this hotel for families as the location is a bit scary at night, particularly walking from the subway to the hotel (which has large gates surrounding it and security cameras everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: lovedupcouple
Reviews.Content: Stayed here due to amazing price (£90) for 3 nights. Its last stop on Metro B line which takes no more than 15 mins from Termini. Hotel is a travel lodge type place, our room had it's own front door - almost like an apartment really. Bed was two singles pushed together, not a huge issue, the beds were firm but after all the walking we slept like logs! No tea and coffee facilities in room (never is in europe) so we took our own. Mini bar which was reasonably priced (but we only used it to store our own stuff)! Safety deposit box and TV and phone - what more do you need! Bathroom was adequate, WC, bidet, sink and shower which was standard size and not huge but unless you spend hours in there it wasn't a problem. Hairdryer in bathroom and an extra plug. Breakfast 7.30-10am was various pastries, cakes, yogurt and cornflakes, coffee and juice. Again adequate. We originally booked a centrally located similar hotel for 3 times the price, the euro is so poor against sterling that we changed it to this hotel and we didn't regret it. Metro runs from 05.30-11.30pm each day and we bought a 3 day ticket for 11 euro. All in all we'd recommend if you're not bothered about having to travel into centre of rome, spend less on your hotel and more on enjoying yourself - we did! Due to time of year we didn't use air conditioning but it appeared to work and could be set to your own requirements. We felt very safe during our entire stay in Rome, there are police everywhere and we didn't encounter any problems or see anything in this area at all.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: snorttney
Reviews.Content: The hotel was all in all not too bad. Disliked the size of the shower [it was very tiny] and the staff weren't very helpful. There was also no phone in your room and they didn't have one in the lobby that you could use. We couldn't seem to figure out how to turn our tv on at first, then when we finally did get it, there were only 2 channels. There were 4 people staying in our room and we had two regular beds and two others that were obviously cots. There wasn't much room for us to keep our suitcases considering the large number of beds in such a small room. Being from Canada, in March it was a lot warmer in Rome than what we were used to back home, and our room didn't have a window so it was very warm at night. We tried to turn on the air conditioning, but it didn't work due to it still being winter. Breakfast was a little different, and was mainly comprised of pastries out of bags, pretty bad coffee and rather gross juice. It was a bit weird that the hotel didn't really have hallways, and the hallways it did have were outside. This made it difficult to descend the stairs when it was raining because they became very slick. Though it's not in the greatest area of the city, it felt very safe because the hotel had a gate that was kept closed during the night. The room was always clean and well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but a bit too far and noisy.”
Reviews.Author: eindhovenaar
Reviews.Content: + Reasonably cheap + Clean - Very far from the main attractions - In a not-very-nice suburb - Next to a highway (too noisy) We stayed here for two nights as the last days of our trip to Italy. The hotel is situated in a suburb far away from many attractions and it does not look like the safest area in Rome. We are told by the reception, however, that they have never had any problems regarding safety of the guests and it might very well be true since it is very close to the metro station and the path from the station to the hotel is along a highway with a bus terminal in between. The rooms are clean yet very basic, thus one should not expect any luxury. The breakfast is also very basic and mainly comprises packaged cakes and bread. There is WiFi internet in the lobby and the breakfast room and a computer with internet access in the lobby. The hotel is situated next to a highway and the rooms are not 100% sound-proof, so during night you may still suffer from the traffic noise. The metro passes right under the hotel and it makes some noise, as well (from 12:30 AM to 5:30AM there is no metro traffic). All in all, it is among the cheapest options for staying in Rome, yet you may think of spending a bit more and staying near the main attractions in a better area.

Reviews.Title: “great for the price you pay”
Reviews.Author: Holiday_year
Reviews.Content: Helpful and friendly staff. Defintiely feel you get your monies worth with the hotel. It is not very expensive, and yet very clean and tidy. Disapointed as requested a double room but it was two single beds put together. Also, it does state that you have sky tv in your room but forgets to mention that all the channels are in Italian! However, nevertheless, when you are in Rome we are sure you will not find the time to watch tv and will be out there enjoying the sites! Therefore, its not a bad deal. Would definitely recommend this hotel if you are looking for somewhere cheap, clean, and close to all main metro links enabling you to do as you please x

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Metro Roma
HotelInfo.Address: Via di Rebibbia 18, 00156 Rome, Italy
